name: Effurun Roundabout
description: A major landmark in Warri, known for its bustling traffic and connection to key parts of the city.

name: Delta Mall (Shoprite)
description: A popular shopping destination offering retail stores, restaurants, and a cinema.

name: Warri Township Stadium
description: A stadium hosting local football matches and events, with a capacity of over 20,000 spectators.

name: Red Mangrove Swamp
address: Near Warri River, Warri, Delta State
description: A unique ecological site showcasing mangrove trees and native wildlife near the Warri River.

name: Nanna Living History Museum
address: Nanna Street, Koko, near Warri, Delta State
description: A museum dedicated to Chief Nanna of the Itsekiri people, featuring historical artifacts and colonial-era relics.

name: Okere Market
description: A traditional market bustling with vendors selling fresh produce, fabrics, and local goods.

name: Warri River
address: Runs through central Warri, Delta State
description: The Warri River is a major navigable channel in the Niger Delta of southern Nigeria, originating around Utagba Uno and flowing southwest towards the Atlantic Ocean.

name: Enerhen Junction
description: A central intersection in Warri, known for its vibrant street life and as a hub for local commuters.
